alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Pearl River; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:05PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern St. Tammany and Washington Parishes, southeastern Walthall, west central Hancock and western Pearl River Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 305 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Crossroads to near Sun to near Pearl River to Stennis Space Center. Movement was west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Bogalusa, Picayune, Franklinton, Pearl River, Varnado, Sun, Enon, Crossroads, Stennis Space Center, Bush, Dexter, Angie and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 3 and 7. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 3 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
